result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijhawan T Earl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -1 day credit of $50.00 applied to costs. Balance to be paid within 60 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

-Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department. 
-After 1 year, Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijhawan T Earl

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Paul Bucher

11:16 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Elijhawan T Earl in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Elijhawan T Earl.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed.  Atty. Bucher confirms parties are prepared to resolve the matter today and recites the offer.  State confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Bucher.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department. 

COSTS: $243.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: Court to apply 1 Day Credit, $50.00, be applied; remainder to be paid within 60 Days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

**After 1 Year expunction is conditionally granted upon payment of all fines/costs in full, defendant has obtained a valid driver's license, maintained employment, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her sentence, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.**
filed by the defense.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

10:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elijhawan T Earl in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Elijhawan T Earl. Atty Bucher provides an update, he is still waiting on an offer from the State.  Atty. Bucher requests a projected plea and sentencing in about 45 days.  State has sent a pretrial offer over to Atty. Bucher and has no objection to the request for adjournment.  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Bucher provide an update, he has discovery.  Court inquires if Atty. Bucher as received a copy of the Amended Complaint.  Atty. records.addlTxt: 10:59 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Elijhawan T Earl in court.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the defendant has filed a petition for court appointed attorney and reviews the petition.  Court approves the petition and orders repayment at $100.00/month with the first payment due 07/01/2022.  Court will have an attorney appointed and will adjourn for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms with the exception for the purposes of completing a CCW class.

02:22 PM Defendant Elijhawan T Earl in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gutierrez appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
